episodeTitle: Heartless Judgment! Margaret is Turned to Stone!!
description: Luffy discovers Hancock's secret when he sees her back. After Hancock's attempts to petrify him fail, he is captured and brought to trial. Marguerite confesses to helping Luffy, and Hancock turns her and her companions to stone as punishment. Enraged by this cruelty, Luffy defeats the execution panther Bacura with a single punch. Hancock's sisters, Sandersonia and Marigold, transform using their Devil Fruit powers to personally execute Luffy.

events.title: Luffy Sees Hancock's Back
events.description: Luffy accidentally sees what is on Hancock's back during their confrontation. He recognizes the mark but doesn't understand its significance. Hancock becomes furious and declares that Luffy must die for seeing her secret.
events.significance: This is the first hint at the Gorgon Sisters' tragic past as slaves of the Celestial Dragons. The mark Luffy sees is the 'Hoof of the Soaring Dragon' slave brand, though this is not revealed until later. This moment drives Hancock's determination to eliminate Luffy and sets up the major backstory reveal that occurs in later episodes.

quotes.text: He saw my back. He'll have to die.
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock's declaration after Luffy sees the mark on her back

events.title: Hancock's Pistol Kiss Fails on Luffy
events.description: Boa Hancock attempts to petrify Luffy using her Mero Mero no Mi ability, specifically the Pistol Kiss technique. However, Luffy is unaffected by her petrification powers because he feels no romantic attraction toward her. Luffy confuses her ability with Foxy's Noro Noro Beam.
events.significance: This is the first demonstration of the Mero Mero no Mi's weakness - it cannot petrify those who do not feel lust or attraction toward the user. This moment showcases Luffy's pure-hearted nature and establishes why Hancock will later become interested in him.

quotes.text: That was just like Foxy's Noro Noro Beam!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's confused reaction to Hancock's Mero Mero powers

events.title: Luffy Brought to the Execution Arena
events.description: Luffy is captured by the Kuja warriors and brought to the execution arena where criminals are judged and sentenced. The entire tribe gathers to witness the trial and execution of the man who invaded their sacred island.
events.significance: This establishes the formal trial setting and shows the rigid law enforcement of Amazon Lily. It demonstrates the severity with which the Kuja treat men who enter their island.

events.title: Marguerite's Confession
events.description: Marguerite steps forward and confesses to bringing Luffy onto the island and helping him. Despite knowing the consequences, she takes full responsibility for her actions and asks Hancock to spare Sweet Pea and Aphelandra, claiming she acted alone.
events.significance: This moment demonstrates Marguerite's noble character and willingness to sacrifice herself for her friends. It also shows the harsh laws of Amazon Lily and Hancock's ruthless enforcement of them. This confession directly leads to one of the episode's most tragic moments.

quotes.text: I brought the man to this island. Please punish only me.
quotes.speaker: Marguerite
quotes.context: Marguerite confessing and trying to protect her friends

events.title: Marguerite, Sweet Pea, and Aphelandra Turned to Stone
events.description: Hancock uses her Mero Mero no Mi powers to turn Marguerite, Sweet Pea, and Aphelandra into stone statues as punishment for helping Luffy. The three women are petrified despite their pleas for mercy. Luffy is horrified and begs Hancock to restore them.
events.significance: This is the most emotionally devastating moment of the episode, showing Hancock's ruthlessness and the true danger of the Mero Mero no Mi. It demonstrates that Hancock can petrify people without requiring them to feel attraction - she can use it as a direct punishment. This event is what truly angers Luffy and motivates his defiance.

quotes.text: Change them back! This is my fault, not theirs!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy pleading with Hancock after she petrifies Marguerite and her friends

events.title: Bacura the Execution Panther Released
events.description: Hancock orders the release of Bacura, a massive black panther who has served as the executioner for Amazon Lily for generations. Bacura is sent to kill Luffy in the arena. The Kuja warriors believe no one can survive Bacura's attack.
events.significance: This introduces Bacura as a traditional method of execution on Amazon Lily and sets up Luffy's impressive display of strength. The Kuja's confidence in Bacura shows how feared this creature is.

quotes.text: Die a proud warrior's death, boy. Bacura leaves not even the bones.
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock ordering Bacura to execute Luffy

events.title: Luffy Defeats Bacura with One Punch
events.description: Enraged by Hancock's treatment of Marguerite and her friends, Luffy unleashes his anger on Bacura. He defeats the massive execution panther with a single devastating punch, sending it flying into the crowd. The entire arena is shocked by this display of power.
events.significance: This moment showcases Luffy's incredible strength and his emotional state when his friends are hurt. It stuns the Kuja warriors who have never seen anyone defeat Bacura so easily. This feat earns Luffy some measure of respect and fear from the Kuja tribe and directly leads to the Gorgon Sisters deciding to fight him personally.

events.title: The Gorgon Sisters Revealed
events.description: Elder Nyon explains to the crowd that Boa Sandersonia and Boa Marigold are Hancock's younger sisters, collectively known as the Gorgon Sisters. She recounts the legend that they defeated a monster called the Gorgon, and as punishment, were cursed with eyes on their backs that would petrify anyone who looks at them.
events.significance: This provides crucial context for the sisters' relationship and the cover story they use to hide their slave marks. While the audience doesn't know it yet, this 'legend' is fabricated to protect the secret of their past as slaves of the Celestial Dragons. This sets up the eventual revelation of the truth in later episodes.

quotes.text: Those three defeated the legendary Gorgon and received a curse for it.
quotes.speaker: Gloriosa (Elder Nyon)
quotes.context: Elder Nyon explaining the fabricated legend of the Gorgon Sisters

events.title: Sandersonia and Marigold's Devil Fruit Transformation
events.description: Boa Sandersonia and Boa Marigold jump into the arena and activate their Devil Fruit powers. Sandersonia transforms using the Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: Anaconda, while Marigold uses the Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: King Cobra. Both sisters transform into massive snake-human hybrids, preparing to personally execute Luffy.
events.significance: This is the debut of both sisters' Devil Fruit abilities. It reveals that multiple members of the Gorgon Sisters possess Zoan-type Devil Fruits, making them formidable fighters. This transformation sets up the battle that will continue in the next episode and demonstrates the power of the Kuja's leadership.

events.title: Luffy vs. The Gorgon Sisters Begins
events.description: The episode ends with Luffy facing off against both Boa Sandersonia and Boa Marigold in their transformed states. The Kuja warriors cheer for the execution while Luffy stands defiant, determined to save Marguerite and her friends.
events.significance: This sets up the major battle that will continue in the following episodes. It establishes the stakes - Luffy must survive and somehow convince the sisters to restore his friends. This is also building toward the eventual revelation of the sisters' tragic past.

themes.description: The episode explores the conflict between strict law enforcement and compassion. Hancock's rigid adherence to Amazon Lily's laws leads her to punish innocent women who showed kindness to a stranger.
themes.symbolism: The stone statues of Marguerite and her friends symbolize the cold, unfeeling nature of justice without mercy.

themes.description: Marguerite's willingness to take full blame and face punishment alone demonstrates true friendship and self-sacrifice. This theme resonates with Luffy's own values.
themes.symbolism: Marguerite stepping forward mirrors the sacrifices Luffy's own crew has made for each other throughout the series.

themes.description: The episode hints at the dark secret on Hancock's back, representing buried trauma and shame. The Gorgon legend is a fabricated story to hide a painful truth.
themes.symbolism: The mark on Hancock's back symbolizes the lasting scars of abuse and slavery, hidden beneath lies to protect one's dignity.
culturalReferences: Greek mythology - The Gorgon myth is used as a cover story

characterSpotlights.development: Marguerite demonstrates her noble character by confessing and trying to save her friends, even at the cost of her own life. Her punishment is heartbreaking and serves as a major emotional catalyst.
keyActions: Is turned to stone by Hancock
quotes: I brought the man to this island. Please punish only me.

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock is portrayed as ruthless and cruel, willing to punish innocent women to maintain her secret and authority. However, hints of her tragic past suggest deeper motivations for her behavior.
keyActions: Attempts to petrify Luffy with Pistol Kiss
quotes: He saw my back. He'll have to die.
Die a proud warrior's death, boy. Bacura leaves not even the bones.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his compassionate nature by taking responsibility for the women's punishment and his fierce strength when protecting others. His inability to be affected by Hancock's beauty showcases his pure heart.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded some scenes in the arena for dramatic effect, particularly the reactions of the Kuja warriors to Bacura's defeat.

trivia.fact: This episode corresponds to Chapter 518 of the manga.
Bacura is a black panther that has served as Amazon Lily's executioner for generations, and Luffy is the first person shown to defeat it so easily.
The Hebi Hebi no Mi fruits eaten by Sandersonia and Marigold were force-fed to them by Celestial Dragons as entertainment, though this is not revealed until Episode 415.
Luffy's immunity to Hancock's Mero Mero no Mi powers is because the ability only works on those who feel lust or attraction toward her, and Luffy feels neither.
